title: A list of characters with Broken kits and why their kits are broken.
body:
{{champion:268}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:64}} Too much of a generalist in the role, when they are passable they end up suffocating the pick process by being too reliable a pick at all levels of play.

{{champion:203}} Putting something in a role that is contrary to what the class wants to succeed at will cause the class to either fail horribly or be absurd.

{{champion:3}} {{champion:6}} Tank stats eat a lot of budget, and trying to balance that with damage on a class that is meant to use range as safety as well causes issues.

{{champion:8}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:420}}  There aren't a lot of good ways to deal with champions that are fairly tanky with incredible sustain, so these champions have all been absolutely destroyed because of it.

{{champion:67}} {{champion:157}}  Without having fair resource usage, champions with particularly good abilities can become absurd very quickly when either the meta favors them or they can abuse an item.

{{champion:28}} Stealth like eve's is still a problem, and it will likely always be a problem.


Riot views all of these problems with a different lense however, clearly. they tend towards trying to buff and nerf generalists, let champs like vayne and yasuo get out of hand before trying to change things, and will likely continue to make things like kalista.
And they will also probably make urgot, galio, and eve rot for the rest of the games existence, not being able to change them without radically changing them, and not being able to balance them in the fluid game league is.
And sustainers will probably be bad for a long time to come, rito needs to fix the stat stick/niche item divide before these guys can be made fair.

Add "overloaded"

{{champion:245}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:64}} and many more bring so much into their kit, it doesn't matter how good you are; those champs will always be better. Diamond 5 Darius vs Diamond 5 yas. You'd expect the lane bully to beat the weak earlygame Yasuo, but no. Because of the overloaded nature of Yas's kit, he abuses everything that would be a "skillcheck" to regular people(Darius Q delay) and just presses E once to dodge it.

Dodging skillshots, staying out of AA range, and what not are blocked by his W and passive. Managing resources is removed... because he's manaless.

If you're investing 1000 hours into a champ, and invest it into yasuo, as opposed to darius, it doesn't matter what happens,Yasuo will just be "Better"

In what way are Kalista and Jayce generalists? They're very specific: Kalista is all about kiting you to hell and back and then executing you while Jayce is all about poking you down and then immediately all inning and bursting you.

kalista is kiting. which is good in all three types of teamcomp. really really good. makes her hard to pick, great for teamfights, and pretty good at siege. when she works she is pretty much always played because she is a general pick, she works with every comp.

jayce is similar, of course a bit different, but similar. he is epecially good with siege, but with a teamwide buff he can work with teamfight, and his pick is also pretty good do to his all in potential. he can also fit every comp pretty well.

Characters should tend to be more specialized than that. especially characters that are supposed to be specialists.
